{"step_by_step_thinking": "EDTA is a chelating agent commonly used in dentistry. It has the ability to bind to and remove calcium ions from the tooth surface, which is known as its chelating action. EDTA is also used as an irrigation solution during root canal treatment to help clean and disinfect the root canal system. Additionally, EDTA has the ability to remove the smear layer, which is a layer of debris and microorganisms that can accumulate on the tooth surface during dental procedures. However, EDTA does not have any direct effect on pulp fixation. Therefore, the correct answer is D. Pulp fixation.", "answer_choice": "D"}
